job_title: Office Automation Clerk in Yokota, Tokyo
pros: The team was very supportive
cons: I do not have any cons.

pros: if you love working with kids then this is the job for you.  It was fun taking care of kids after school. If you are a teacher you get your own grade level to watch after school if you are not a teacher you are paired up with one.
cons: having to travel from one school to another sometimes.  Good luck on school breaks in a city like Irvine where the kids go to school year round. When they are on break odds are you are going to have a full class of kids since no parent in Irvine watches their kids during these breaks so you better be ready for full on mayhem, these kids do not like to be at the day care during break and they act out all the time. One parent even made their child not take his ADHD medication during break and boy was that fun. Sometimes the site supervisor will tell you that you will be working at another location for a couple of weeks to help out, when you get over there you find out the kids are on break from school so you have to deal with them during their break and you do not know these kids so you have no authority over them, they will not recognize you as an authority figure because you are fresh meat.

job_title: Character Artist in Fort Worth, TX

job_title: Child Care Worker in Fort Bragg, NC

job_title: Child and Youth Program Assistant in Nellis AFB, NV

pros: They pay you good money to start without experience.
cons: Crazy hours when you are a flex. Never get vacation time as a flex. Be prepared to be called in all the time because they have an EXTREMELY HIGH turnover rate here.

job_title: Family Support Specialist in Missoula, MT
pros: There are kind families to work with.  It is rewarding to work with children with special needs.
cons: High case loads, lack of leadership, leadership gossips and bullies lower staff - most likely because of stress.  Very stressful job.  Problems with job security, funding is sketchy.  Threats concerning job loss are offered during staff meetings which increases stress.  Need to drive long distances in the winter which can be very scary with icy roads - if you apply make sure to get snow tires. Leadership is more concerned about making money than serving families.  Benefits continue to be cut each year.  Health insurance is very expensive.

review_title: I have worked at child development center for 7 years working with children from 6 weeks of age on up to 12 years of age
job_title: Lead Toddler Teacher in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: flexible hours to work around school and family functions.
cons: poorly managed, didn't pay for training needed yearly, cared only about their own pocket book rather than the ones doing all the work.

job_title: Assistant Preschool Teacher in Walnut, CA
pros: The head teachers are very eager to guide their assistant teachers to become better educators.
cons: Some of the parents can be hard to deal with. I remember one parent who would tell us off and her kid, because the kid was constantly, "insisting" on track sandbox sand to her mother's car. Her child was only 3, kids like sand... I had no idea what that mom wanted us to do.

pros: The children were a joy to work with. The other employees were great!
cons: It is a stressful job and not for those who don't have patience. There wasn't always time for breaks.
